item.title: Report E-2023100792
item.description:
Report E-2023100792

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated he went into the store to obtain a veeder reading. Driver did state, the load amount was 3000 gallons per delmo but dialed it back. Driver stated at first, he didn’t stick diesel tank but stuck the gas drop. Then he mentioned stick was broke and couldn’t get an accurate amount in diesel tank and mentioned he did stick the tank. Driver states he started dropping diesel and then hooked up Unleaded and started to drop it also. Driver observed diesel not flowing and started gas while trying to figure out problem with diesel. Driver had to stop diesel flow several times to allow tank to breathe and lifted drop gun off fitting in ground allowing it to drain down. Driver completed unleaded drop and was clearing hose when he seen product coming from drop. Driver cleaned up with spill pads. Driver reported to store but left scene with cones around spill to later return and put down oil dry to finish cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2023100784
item.description:
Report E-2023100784

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LOO experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid release from multiple boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to a load shift. Sodium bicarb and absorbents were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted area. All impacted absorbents, impacted cardboard, and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All damaged bottles of product were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100783
item.description:
Report E-2023100783

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: OLIVETTE
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had 4000 gals of DEI in the 1st Compartment, and was moving to the next Compartment where he checked the hose and cam locks which were good. The second he pulled the internal valve, it blew a cam lock off the side of Compartment 3. Estimates 5 to 10 gallons of Diesel spilled onto the cement. Driver cleaned up with spill pads and floor dry. Trailer was repaired and delivery was made the same day with no further issues.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1866 Ease Release 205 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023100759

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 16, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged five (5) gallon drum and placed it in a drum for disposal. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product from the impacted area. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: On October 16, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of UN1903 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents powder to remediate the UN1903-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100757
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon jugs of UN3149 were crushed during transport and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer, pavement, and dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 20-gallon drum for future disposal.

  • Description: On October 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printing ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN1210 and containerized it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remove any residual product. All UN1210 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of the waste.

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: VALPARAISO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023, one (1) 337-gallon tote of UN3266 leaked approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior due to a loose lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

  • City: MONTEBELLO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES L
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon drum of UN1789 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the site. PES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the hydrochloric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. PES personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pail of product. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023, three (3) 48-pound boxes of UN3262 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the loading dock floor and pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a HEPA filter drum vacuum to remove the free-standing product from the impacted area. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged boxes and all UN3262 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal purposes. The undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued processing and shipping.

  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN3266 ProClean Egg Wash release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8' x 9' area of the trailer floor and a 20' x 4' area of the concrete lot below the trailer floor due to a pallet puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and citric acid solution were utilized to clean and neutralize all impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, one (1) one-gallon bottle of UN1789 was crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and swept them in with hand tools. EWI solidified and neutralized the remaining product in the damaged 1-gallon jug and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All spent absorbents, damaged cardboard, and cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon bucket.

  • Description: On October 10, 2023, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted loading dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. HES personnel restacked the undamaged cargo for normal transport. All spent absorbents and damaged pails were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

  • Description: On October 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Loctite Frekote PMC (UN1993) was damaged by a pinhole, from a skid, and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Serivices, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental (ME) to remediate the site. Crews utilized an 85-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. ME personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect the released product from the impacted areas. Crews removed two damaged boards from the impacted pallet, and returned the salvaged pallet to R+L. All Loctite Frekote PMC (UN1993) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum, and the previously mentioned 85-gallon overpack, and R+L personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Description: On October 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3149 was crushed during transit due to improper blocking and bracing techniques and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and gravel below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Union Pacific (UP) personnel would not allow any third-party contractors on-site without prior approval. At approximately 8:15 PM CDT, a crew from GES arrived on-site and were instructed to remain on standby until further notice. It was later determined that GES personnel would not be authorized to make entry onto UP property and any remediation would be handled by another party retained by UP. CES and GES were advised to stand down by Mr. Judah.

All UN2922-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

The waste was left at the terminal to be managed by terminal personnel.

  • Description: Tank truck and pup trailer were involved in a rollover incident while trying to enter the customer's site- Costco Wholesale, 300 W. Dimond Blvd, Anchorage, AK. The tank shell failed when it experienced an abrasion during the rollover. The driver was removed from the vehicle and the fire dept placed putty on the tank shell to stop the release of additional hazardous material. Once the scene was rendered safe by the fire department, cleanup operations commenced with the placement of absorbent boom and absorbent materials. Storm drains and manways were blocked. Released matter was contained to less than a 200 square foot area. Product was transferred out of the containers and delivered to the intended destination. Variance of what was lifted versus metered into the customer tank was approximately 20USWG.

Waste was staged and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/23/2023 at 0139 hours a 16 rail car and 1 locomotive derailed in Hyattsville, Maryland at BAA 33.4 milepost at the Baltimore Avenue crossing intersecting Emerson Street. UTLX910325 (residue UN2370 Hexene) and UTLX91084 (residue UN1075 liquefied petroleum gas) derailed on their side with no leaks. 14 closed hopper cars with polyurethane pellets derailed with various orientations and varying levels of leaked pellets. The shipper, Shell Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 2023-0923-00020). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, as well as (2) Managers of Hazardous Materials from CSX, were dispatched to the scene to assess the damaged hazardous material tank cars, contain leaked pellets, and remediate a minor fuel release from the derailed locomotive. The crossing at Baltimore Avenue and Emerson Street were closed for approximately 7 days as a result of the derailment.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY AN 8 OUNCE FUEL SAMPLE IN A 12 OUNCE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE HAD RELEASED ENOUGH FUEL VAPORS TO REMOVE THE LABEL FROM THE SAMPLE AND DAMPEN THE INNER PACKAGING. INNER DOCUMENTATION CONTAINED AN SDS SHOWING THE PRODUCT TO BE REGULATED AS DIESEL FUEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

It was transporting 11,000.00 gallons of Jet Fuel, soon to reach its destination the truck crashed, overturning the truck and tank, causing a spill, an estimated jet fuel loss of 1,540 gallons on the ground. state agencies were activated for emergency management; Environmental Quality Board, Puerto Rico Police, Firefighters, Transportation Bureau and Other public services and Environmental Emergency cleaning company to clean the area impacted by the spill. Industrial cranes were required to lift the tank and truck. The product left the truck through the blind cover on the tank due to the pressure that the product exerted on it. The estimated time to complete the work of moving the truck and tank from the accident site was 6 hours. The immediate activation of the resources that manage emergencies and the actions of the personnel who work with the management of the containment and cleaning of the hazardous material, ensured that the impact was controlled.

  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at the customer in Bumside, LA. When he stopped at the guard shack to check in, he noticed product coming from his crash box on top of the trailer. Driver climbed on top of the trailer to see where the product was coming from. Upon inspection, driver could see that the grommet where the air/nitrogen line hooks up had a crack in it. At this time it appeared this was what had caused the leak. Mechanic was called out to make repairs by replacing the grommet. Once mechanic got on scene, he discovered that the valve had been left open causing the product to come out of the line. Mechanic replaced the cracked grommet and closed the valve. Environmental company was called out to clean the product off the ground and to clean the trailer. Driver was able to off load without any further issues.

  • Description: Bobtail Roll Over Accident. The Wheel went off the side of the road, driver tried to pull it back onto the road and lost control. No other vehicles involved. No other property damage. Ferrellgas Employee was injured and taken by ambulance to a local hospital where he was treated and released. There was a minimal release of propane of approx 5.2 gallons. A piping broke that connected to the filler system. The Ferrellgas employee was able to turn the shut off valve to the tank.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FERRELLGAS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Bobtail drier was driving on Hwy 512 in the far left lane, there was a dump truck hauling a pump trailer in front of him. Apparently a vehicle in front of the dump truck hit its brakes, the dump truck hit its brakes and our bobtail rear ended the truck truck& its trailer. The Ferrellgas employee was injured and sought medical treatment at Concentra Urgent care where he was treated and released for cuts, bruises to both legs and knees. The bolt on the pump broke and the gas in the lines to the meter released. Our employee was able to shut off the valve to the release.
